results.title: Vandalism
results.creator_credit: Lesley Hammond, South Australian Film Corporation and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description: Why does vandalism occur? This film attempts to explore the psychological makeup of the vandal with special attention being paid to motivators like frustration and boredom through dramatisations: young woman on the way to a disco gets harassed; four youths take a joy ride in the hope of torching a school. Film also includes interviews and actual photographs of vandalism provided by the South Australian Police Force. Cast includes Jamie West, Rosanna Cassin, Joe Franco, Tim Glass. Written by John Dick.

results.title: Horse drawn magic
results.creator_credit: George Johnson, ONF | NFB and Dorothy Todd Henaut
results.brief_description: The Caravan Stage Company is the only horse-drawn open-air theatre in the world. The film shows them on the road and in performance bringing live entertainment to communities where television is often the main diversion. In a montage of short sketches, the film shows the troupe on the road and in performance. Hard work and laughter are basic ingredients of this unconventional lifestyle.

results.title: Boppo's bike ride
results.creator_credit: South West Institute of TAFE, Allan Parker, Yaraan Bundle and Ivan Couzens
results.brief_description:
A grandfather/grandaughter collaboration, this is one man’s journey through place and time from the 1930s-1960s. Ivan Couzens reminisces about the days when riding a bike was the only way to get around; school was a five mile ride away; and when he started work at the Bluestone quarries, the bicycle was his only mode of transport. A light-hearted look at the past interspersed with photographs and images of places once travelled. Music: “Greenflower” by Rob Bundle.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: In your hands: hygiene in the food industry
results.creator_credit: Catherine Murphy, Rodney Land and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Highlights aspects of food handling which are the personal responsibility of the food handler. Discusses the sources of potentially hazardous bacteria and the various means by which these bacteria may be transferred to food.

results.title: Taken by storm
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Cockram, Stella Productions, Telefeatures, South Australian Film Corporation and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description: A dramatised film designed to promote an understanding and acceptance of an increasing program of replenishing Adelaide’s beaches. It would be useful in other cities which suffer similar problems. Local councils, secondary students, beachfront dwellers and anyone who enjoys the beach will find this film informative

results.title: The Day after trinity
results.creator_credit: Jon Else and KTEH-TV (Television station : San Jose, Calif.)
results.brief_description: A documentary on the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, focusing on his role in the development of the atomic bomb and the dramatic events preceding the world’s first atomic bomb explosion on July 16, 1945. A penetrating commentary on scientific inquiry, Oppenheimer’s fall from grace during the McCarthy era, and the tragedy of continuing nuclear proliferation.

results.title: CPR for citizens
results.brief_description: Basic techniques for emergency care of heart attack and choking victims, which allows the person at the scene of the attack to keep the heart pumping and the brain alive until help arrives. Identifies the principles of cardio-pulmonary resuscitation and explains its importance. Uses a mannequin and simple clear explanations for demonstrations. Commentary by Orson Welles.

results.title: Life in the trees
results.creator_credit: John Sparks, Richard Attenborough, Reiner Moritz Productions, Warner Bros Pictures and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Life on Earth”.
David Attenborough examines the evolution of the primates. As well as looking at the better known members of the ape family - monkeys, gorillas and chimpanzees - it also looks at some of the lesser known cousins. This episode contains the memorable scene where David Attenborough meets a group of young mountain gorillas in Zaire.

results.title: Pride and prejudice
results.creator_credit: Terry Jennings, Chrysalis Films, South Australian Film Corporation and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: Part 5 of a series on Australian women artists, examining some of their thoughts, struggles, aspirations, influences and disappointments, and the effect of sexual discrimination and stereotyping. Some of the women strongly believe in using their art as a form of political protest, but they all agree that their aim is to bring Australia out of the cultural desert and bring recognition to women generally as artists in their own right. The painters and sculptors include: Inge King, Margaret Hinder, Margaret Priest, Mirka Mora, Rinske Car, Anne Newmarch, Denese Oates, Kate Briscoe, Joan Grounds, Bonita Ely, Micky Allan and holographer, Margaret Benyon. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Assertive skills training (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chrysalis Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This program uses a series of playlets to illustrate unassertive behaviour, the benefits resulting from assertive behaviour and better communication in personal interactions. The six segments are entitled; Work, Couples, Families, Conversations, Requests, Neighbours.
